summary:
Diligent, self-motivated and ambitious individual with strong interpersonal skills and over six years 
experience in Product- and Market Merchandising as well as a strong background in Design .
Due to my proactive and approachable nature, I am an excellent team player who is able to prioritise and 
use initiative to drive the agenda. I can manage stakeholders to get the desired outcome and use my 
outstanding problem solving skills. Working in a fast-paced environment for several years has strengthened my 
apt organisation and time management skills even further. Prepared to go the extra mile to deliver targets.

profile_positions.description:
Managing all categories for the TJ Men‘s ACC global styles
Range planning towards targets, incl. SKU count, forecasting of units & budget, price structure, margin targets, collection tiering, delivery flow, assortments and product stories
Partnered with Design and Development in sketch-, proto and pricing review and refining collection based on outcome
Presenting collection to global markets incl. strategic KPI’s and finalizing based on market feedback
Working closely with Product Development & Design in all stages of collection
Reviewing and analyzing performance of sell out with global markets and O&O channels and strengthening each partnership
Creating regular KPI reports, e.g. budget, productivity, strategic product plans
Attending research trips as inspiration for trends to incorporate in new collections
Main contact for execution of all TJ ACC capsules & collaborations
profile_positions.title: Senior Merchandiser Tommy Jeans Men‘s Accessories
Product Merchandiser Tommy Jeans Men‘s Accessories

profile_positions.description:
Focusing on the capsule collections and collaborations and International Markets (APAC, LATAM, US)
Maintaining a strong relationship with the regions outside of Europe through regular exchanges about collection performance, market needs and strategies
Managing all Merchandising processes for capsule collections for the Accessories team
Being in close contact with all other divisions to align on product for capsule projects
Managing timelines and being flexible with reacting to changes quickly
Managing all International Market special styles to react to local competition
Linking in all relevant teams (e.g. Design, PD, Buying, Operations, Planning) on all capsule-related updates
Feeding back and filtering collection information from markets to product merchandising team for the seasonal collections
Presenting back seasonal collection to global sales teams as a product training
Leading presentations to global sales teams on capsules and IM special collections
Setting up a process for Capsules and International Markets within the division
profile_positions.title: Market Merchandiser Accessories

profile_positions.description:
Reporting directly into the WSW Market Merchandising Director Operating as the link between Product Merchandising and global markets as well as internal departments 
Daily contact with EMEA and international markets to understand trade and consumer patterns Influencing the Womenswear product assortments by providing detailed market feedback to Merchandising team 
Partnering with cross functional teams, e.g. Consumer Insights, Digital Selling Team, Marketing, Supply Chain to maximise productivity and sell through 
Delivering quarterly collection training to global markets 
Attending key appointments Informing markets about all product-related changes Inviting markets to key meetings 
Managing the product shoot for all digital sales tools according to the budget 
Managing the set up of all digital sales tools, e.g. Digital Showroom, iPad  
Sharing relevant market information internally and externally and supporting countries globally with marketing and sales material Analysing sell out results 
Preparing seasonal key meetings 
Overseeing countries' seasonal budgets and targets during and after the selling season 
Managing an Intern
profile_positions.title: Junior Market Merchandiser Womenswear

profile_positions.description:
Assisting the Wholesale Manager and team by communicating with customers, like Harrods, Fortnum and Mason, Fenwicks and agencies in Asia, Canada, USA, Italy and Scandinavia
Assisting in the management and shipping coordination of SMS/sample collection for worldwide and local showrooms as Asia, Canada or within Europe in collaboration with Design, Buying and Product Development
Implementing critical paths in stock control and delivery deadlines
Prioritising stock deliveries for key accounts
Acting as one of the main contacts for worldwide Wholesale customers on a day-to-day basis
Assisting with general administration duties in the Wholesale Department in all categories as Menswear, Womenswear and Childrenswear
Assisting in stock control and collection sendout to all of our global customers
Assisting in analyzing seasonal best sellers
Assisting in forecasting expected sales volumes
Keeping the London showroom in representative condition at all times
Assisting with Visual Merchandising guidelines for the showroom in collaboration with the VM Stylist
Booking international collections, e.g. to Japan or Canada, in direct contact with suppliers and communicating with UPS, DHL and couriers, creating commercial invoices and providing them with delivery materials
Swap styles and finding alternatives for cancelled or oversold styles
In charge of reorders and allocations
Assisting in developing seasonal range plans
Working to deadlines for stock delivery
Ensuring to deliver the highest standards at all times and protecting the brand in all actions
Promoted from Wholesale Intern to Assistant in January 2016
profile_positions.title: Wholesale Assistant

profile_positions.description:
Next to studying and later interning in Berlin, I have worked part-time at Burberry with the following activities:

Sales
- Provide an iconic customer experience at all times
- Present oneself professionally and in line with the brand image and company grooming guidelines
- Be perceptive of customers needs, listening and showing enthusiasm for the product and brand
- Proactively develop the sale by selecting an appropriate range of options for the customer, providing good product knowledge, overcoming objections and offering appropriate additional items
- Ensure customer loyalty by concluding the sale, quickly and efficiently processing purchases at the till, capturing customer data to ensure future contact, ensuring aftercare promises are kept
- Effectively deal with telephone orders and enquiries
 - Be aware of the procedure for dealing with customer complaints
 - Understand promotional activities in the store
- Strive to meet individual sales targets and be aware of store sales targets
- Build up and maintain a client book

Merchandise
- Adhere to the visual merchandising guidelines
- Replenish merchandise ensuring appropriate stock levels are maintained at all times
- Participate in stocktaking as required and to ensure accurate counting of stock
- Maintain the highest standards of housekeeping and retail standards within the store
profile_positions.title: Part-time Sales Assistant

profile_positions.description:
- Assisting in the design process, including researching and sketching the AW 2015/16 collection, which will be presented at Berlin Fashion Week
- Creating the complete mood board
- Fabric choices for the upcoming collection
- realizing the sample collection
- assisting in photo and look book shoots and styling collections for the online-store
- liaising with sponsors, (online-)stores
- acquiring sponsors and stores
- acquiring VIPs for events and communicating with their agencies
- developing products focussing on quality, manufacturing and detail improvements as well as keeping an eye on the budget and deadline
- co-ordinating sample fitting sessions
- co-ordinating the production team
- creative pattern making of the entire sample collection
profile_positions.title: Design Intern

profile_positions.description:
- Taking orders for brands like Duvetica, Daks London, Alpha Studios and Luigi Borelli for Germany, Switzerland and Austria at ‘’Premium’’ fashion fairs in Berlin and Düsseldorf as well as in the Munich Showroom
- Merchandising of incoming collections
- Designing Mailings for acquiring new customers and giving Brand introductions
- acquiring stores and liaising with wholesale customers
profile_positions.title: Merchandising  and Wholesale Intern

profile_positions.description:
4 weeks Work Experience with the Product Merchandising, Childrenswear - Assisted the Childrenswear team in the run up to brand buy, thus
acquired first hand knowledge about the lifecycle of a collection and Burberry’s ways of working
- Gained insight into the process of developing a collection with an understanding of
option counts, seasonality of product deliveries and (sampling) budgets
- Participated in allocation and helped with the preparations for range plan handover
- Attended fitting sessions with design and PD
- Gathered first insight into weekly and monthly trade reporting and margin reviews
- Worked closely with the CAD team on the children’s overviews in the run up to brand buy
profile_positions.title: Product Merchandising Intern
